Interpretation: Return on Assets (ROA). Higher values indicate better profitability.
Debt ratio. Higher values indicate higher financial leverage and risk.
Proportion of assets in liquid form. Higher is better for short-term obligations.
Current ratio. Values > 1 indicate ability to cover short-term debts.

Full_Name: [(Cash + Short-term Securities + Receivables - Short-term Liabilities) / (Operating Expenses - Depreciation)] * 365
Formula: [(cash + short-term securities + receivables - short-term liabilities) / (operating expenses - depreciation)] * 365
Interpretation: Days of cash coverage. Negative values indicate immediate liquidity problems.
Cumulative profitability. Part of Altman Z-Score.
Operating profitability. Key indicator of core business performance.

Full_Name: Book Value of Equity / Total Liabilities
Formula: book value of equity / total liabilities
Interpretation: Equity cushion. Higher values indicate stronger solvency.
Asset turnover efficiency. Higher values indicate better asset utilization.
Equity ratio. Complement of debt ratio.

Full_Name: (Gross Profit + Extraordinary Items + Financial Expenses) / Total Assets
Formula: (gross profit + extraordinary items + financial expenses) / total assets
Interpretation: Adjusted profitability including non-operating items.
Ability to cover short-term debt with profits.
Gross margin adjusted for depreciation.
Profitability before interest expense.
Days to repay all debt with operating cash. Lower is better.
Operating cash generation relative to debt.
Asset coverage of liabilities. Values > 1 indicate positive equity.
Gross return on assets.
Gross profit margin. Key profitability indicator.
Days inventory outstanding. Lower indicates faster turnover.
Year-over-year sales growth ratio.

Full_Name: Profit on Operating Activities / Total Assets
Formula: profit on operating activities / total assets
Interpretation: Operating return on assets.
Net profit margin. Bottom-line profitability.
Multi-year cumulative profitability.
Retained earnings as proportion of assets.
Cash generation relative to debt burden.

Full_Name: Profit on Operating Activities / Financial Expenses
Formula: profit on operating activities / financial expenses
Interpretation: Interest coverage ratio. Higher values indicate ability to service debt.
Liquidity relative to long-term assets.
Company size. Larger firms may have different risk profiles.
Net debt burden relative to revenue.
Profitability before interest cost.
Days payable outstanding. Payment cycle to suppliers.
Operating expense burden relative to short-term debt.
Operating expense burden relative to total debt.
Sales profitability relative to asset base.
Asset turnover. Efficiency of asset utilization.
Quick assets coverage of long-term debt.
Permanent capital proportion.
Operating profit margin.
Most conservative liquidity ratio. Only cash and equivalents.

Full_Name: Total Liabilities / ((Profit on Operating Activities + Depreciation) * (12/365))
Formula: total liabilities / ((profit on operating activities + depreciation) * (12/365))
Interpretation: Months of operating cash needed to repay all debt.
Operating profit margin. Core business profitability.

Full_Name: Rotation Receivables + Inventory Turnover in Days
Formula: rotation receivables + inventory turnover in days
Interpretation: Total operating cycle length. Lower is better.
Days sales outstanding. Collection period.
Profitability per unit of inventory.
Quick ratio. Liquidity without relying on inventory sales.
Days inventory outstanding based on COGS.

Full_Name: EBITDA (Profit on Operating Activities - Depreciation) / Total Assets
Formula: EBITDA (profit on operating activities - depreciation) / total assets
Interpretation: EBITDA return on assets.

Full_Name: EBITDA (Profit on Operating Activities - Depreciation) / Sales
Formula: EBITDA (profit on operating activities - depreciation) / sales
Interpretation: EBITDA margin. Cash operating profitability.
Short-term assets coverage of all liabilities.
Proportion of assets funded by short-term debt.
Payables period based on COGS.
Equity coverage of long-term assets.
Permanent capital funding of fixed assets.
Absolute working capital. Current assets minus current liabilities.
Alternative calculation of gross margin.

Full_Name: (Current Assets - Inventory - Short-term Liabilities) / (Sales - Gross Profit - Depreciation)
Formula: (current assets - inventory - short-term liabilities) / (sales - gross profit - depreciation)
Interpretation: Days company can operate without additional cash inflow.
Cost efficiency. Lower is better.
Long-term debt-to-equity ratio. Financial leverage.
Inventory turnover ratio. Higher indicates faster movement.
Receivables turnover. Higher indicates faster collection.
Payables period based on sales.
Payables turnover rate.
Fixed asset turnover. Efficiency of long-term assets.
